basics.name: Louis Andrew

basics.summary: Software Engineer specializing in full-stack development with expertise in modern technologies such as Vue, React, TypeScript, and Node.js. Experienced in solving complex technical challenges and delivering measurable business impact. Passionate about writing clean, maintainable code, implementing industry best practices, and building scalable systems

work.name: Free2Move Deutschland GmbH
work.summary:
Led development efforts across multiple projects while other engineers. Spearheaded process improvements and established engineering standards as well as providing technical guidance to stakeholders.

 Tech Stack: Nuxt3/Vue3, Tailwind, GraphQL, TypeScript, Node, Go, AWS Stack (SNS, SQS, etc.), Docker + K8s, RabbitMQ
highlights: Leading development on the contact page (a WebView embedded into the native app) as an initiative of CS contact cost reduction, reducing direct calls and unstructured contact by providing alternative contact options such as context-aware contact options or chatbot
Established processes to improve knowledge distribution across team members and preparatory plan to introduce new team members into the team oncall rotation

Led efforts to establish conventions (e.g. deployment and/or provisioning methods) and best practices within the team as well as helped other team members through mentoring and frequent knowledge sharing

work.name: Share NOW GmbH / Free2Move
work.summary:
Acting as the lead frontend engineer in the team alongside being a mentor to other engineers. Also, dove deep into asynchronous messaging by building a system that processes live rental data.

 Stack: Nuxt3/Vue3, Tailwind, GraphQL/Apollo, TypeScript, Node/Express
highlights: Designed and implemented asynchronous system that processes live rental data so that suspicious rentals can be monitored and possibly marked to prevent fraud / theft attempts
Developed reimbursement feature for users that fueled a car during their rental, improving internal processes and reducing contact cost regarding fueling reimbursement

work.name: Share NOW GmbH
work.summary:
Continuing my work in Share NOW right after graduating from my studies. Created and succesfully executed a migration plan to migrate the company backoffice application (Vue 2) into a Nuxt3 (Vue3) project, thus increasing its performance (LCP, 75th percentile) from 4.2s to 2s.

Stack: Vue2 + Nuxt3/Vue3, Tailwind, GraphQL/Apollo, TypeScript, Node/Express
highlights: Coordinated migration process of an application with micro-frontend architecture across multiple teams

Increased web performance of the app (Largest Contentful Paint / LCP) from 4.2s to 2.6s by reducing unecessary complexities and employing optimization methods such as proper code-splitting and cacheable assets

work.name: Share NOW GmbH
work.summary:
Working as a software-engineer intern alongside my studies. Contributed into the backoffice application of the company, built with micro-frontend architecture and to the company-wide component library.

Stack: Vue2, SCSS, GraphQL, TypeScript/JavaScript
highlights: Worked on the backoffice application of the company, built with Vue2 and micro-frontend architecture at its core. Contributed to company-wide component library (built in Vue2). Migrated existing components to TypeScript

work.name: Etheral
work.summary:
Etheral is a local business in Indonesia that sells handmade jewelries. I worked with them to build their e-commerce website https://etheralmade.com. Unfortunately the original domain is no longer available, the site is still accessible at https://fervent-minsky-bc0840.netlify.app/.

Feature for the site includes: payment integration, mailing list subscription, multi-user admin dashboard, on-demand shipping cost calculation, and order confirmation email.

Stack: React/Gatsby, Styled Components, Firestore, Netlify Lambda, TypeScript
highlights: Built an e-commerce site for a local handmade jewelries busineess. Worked closely with the client to design the website and its features: user auth, payment integration, storage system and admin dashboard
